Class MyStringMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • MyStringMethods

  • public class MyStringMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Copies 10 methods from the String class using character arrays.
    Version:
    2/26/2019
    Author:
    Austin Lowery

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) char[] letters 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyStringMethods()
      No-args constructor sets original string to a blank String and the letters to that blank
      MyStringMethods(java.lang.String start)
      Stores the parameter to the original string and makes the letters into a character array of the original string.

    • Method Detail

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int index)
        Returns the character at a specific index from within a String. Gives a blank character and error message if out of range.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the string's character location
        Returns:
        result - the character at the index or the lack thereof

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(MyStringMethods other)
        Returns a negative number if the other string is higher, a zero if they're equal, and a positive number if the other is lower. If the original is the first part of other, a negative is returned. If other is the first part of the original, a positive number is returned.
        Parameters:
        other - a MyStringMethods object to compare to the original being used
        Returns:
        answer - resulting number for comparing the two strings

      • compareToIgnoreCase

        public int compareToIgnoreCase(MyStringMethods other)
        Returns a negative number if the other string is higher, a zero if they're equal, and a positive number if the other is lower. If the original is the first part of other, a negative is returned. If other is the first part of the original, a positive number is returned. Case is ignored in this method.
        Parameters:
        other - a MyStringMethods object to compare to the original being used
        Returns:
        answer - resulting number for comparing the two strings

      • equals

        public boolean equals(MyStringMethods other)
        Checks if two strings are equal or not.
        Parameters:
        other - a MyStringMethods object to compare to the original being used
        Returns:
        checkEqual - determines if the two strings are equal

        Gets the original string from the object.
        Returns:
        original - the string stored in the object

        public int indexOf(char findChar)
        Checks the first instance of a character in a string.

        public java.lang.String replace(char oldChar,
                                char newChar)
        Replaces a specified character with another character.
        Parameters:

        newChar - the character that the old character is changed to
        Returns:
